decks.notes: This deck focuses on assembling the Allosaurus Combo, utilizing cards like Allosaurus Rider, Eldritch Evolution, and Neoform to quickly cheat out powerful creatures like Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant and Griselbrand onto the battlefield. The deck also includes support cards like Pact of Negation and Veil of Summer to protect the combo and disrupt opponents. The goal is to generate a powerful board presence quickly and overwhelm the opponent before they can respond effectively. The deck aims to be fast and efficient in executing its combo strategy in order to secure the win.

This deck focuses on filling the graveyard with creatures and then casting Living End to bring them all back onto the battlefield at the same time. The key strategy is to cycle through cards like Street Wraith and Curator of Mysteries to quickly fill the graveyard, while using cards like Shardless Agent and Generous Ent to maintain card advantage. With the ability to cascade into Living End with cards like Ardent Plea, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a powerful board presence and swing the game in its favor.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying creatures and disrupting the opponent's game plan with disruptive spells and abilities. It utilizes a variety of aggressive creatures like Ragavan and Phelia to pressure opponents while using cards like Ranger-Captain of Eos to search for key pieces. The deck also includes removal spells like Solitude and Prismatic Ending to handle threats efficiently. The mana base is designed to support the multicolor nature of the deck while also incorporating utility lands like Arena of Glory and Elegant Parlor.

This deck revolves around cycling creatures with powerful effects to fill the graveyard, then casting Living End to bring them all back onto the battlefield at once. Using various counter spells and card draw to control the game until you can execute the combo, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a sudden surge of creatures and take over the game. Key cards like Curator of Mysteries, Endurance, and Shardless Agent help facilitate the cycling and graveyard filling, while cards like Force of Negation and Subtlety provide protection and disruption.

This deck relies on aggressive creatures such as Phlage, Ragavan, and Scion of Draco to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It also includes a mix of removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Leyline Binding to control the board. The inclusion of Leyline of the Guildpact enhances the power of the deck by buffing all multicolored creatures. The deck also features a small counter package with Stubborn Denial and includes some utility cards like Consign to Memory and Winternight Stories. The mana base is optimized for consistency and speed.

This Jeskai Aggro deck focuses on a mix of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to control the board and push damage through quickly. It leverages powerful cards like Ragavan, Phelia, and Phlage to apply pressure early, while using versatile removal like Prismatic Ending and Wrath of the Skies to deal with opposing threats. The deck also includes counterspells like Spell Snare and tempo plays like Ephemerate to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the strategy revolves around a fast and aggressive game plan backed up by control elements to secure victory.

This deck focuses on combining aggressive creatures with powerful spells to control the board and disrupt the opponent. It utilizes a mix of efficient removal spells like Prismatic Ending and Supreme Verdict, along with disruptive creatures like Teferi, Time Raveler to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes a strong finisher in Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, supported by cards like Solitude and Quantum Riddler to maintain pressure on the opponent. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the diverse range of spells and creatures in the deck.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying cheap artifacts to take advantage of the affinity mechanic, enabling a fast and aggressive playstyle. By using cards like Kappa Cannoneer and Memnite alongside efficient artifacts like Mishra's Bauble and Mox Opal, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a flurry of threats early in the game. Engineered Explosives and Springleaf Drum provide additional utility and support, while Urza's Saga can help generate additional threats. Thoughtcast helps the deck maintain its tempo by drawing cards, allowing it to continue applying pressure and disrupting opponents' strategies.

This deck focuses on quickly playing aggressive creatures to deal damage to the opponent as fast as possible. It includes powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Scion of Draco, along with efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt. The deck also utilizes Leyline Binding and Leyline of the Guildpact to protect your creatures and improve their power. With a mana base that can support a wide range of colors, this aggro deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of speed and resilience.

This deck focuses on utilizing the Amulet of Vigor to gain extra mana and speed up the deck's combo potential. By using cards like Primeval Titan and Scapeshift to search for key lands such as Gruul Turf and Boseiju, Who Endures, the deck can quickly assemble powerful combinations like Malevolent Rumble to control the board or activate Urza's Saga for additional threats. By carefully managing resources and sequencing plays, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a powerful board state and close out the game efficiently.

The deck focuses on assembling a powerful board state with Emrakul, the Promised End and other Eldrazi creatures, supported by Blade of the Bloodchief to enhance their abilities. Utilizing Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble to control the opponent's board while utilizing Vexing Bauble for card advantage and disruption. The deck also includes utility cards like Soul-Guide Lantern, Pithing Needle, and Thought-Knot Seer to disrupt the opponent's strategy. With the support of lands like Boseiju, Who Endures and Urza's Saga, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its powerful creatures and combo potential.

The deck focuses on quickly getting key creatures into the graveyard and then reanimating them using spells like Goryo's Vengeance. Cards like Psychic Frog and Quantum Riddler help with card selection and digging for combo pieces. The goal is to set up powerful combos that can win the game in a single turn, leveraging creatures like Griselbrand and Ulamog, the Defiler. Protection comes in the form of Force of Negation and other disruptive spells while also having some interaction with cards like Thoughtseize and Prismatic Ending. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo and win the game before the opponent can react effectively.

This deck focuses on quickly getting key creatures from your graveyard onto the battlefield to create a powerful board presence. By using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate, you can bring back creatures like Griselbrand and Superior Spider-Man for a powerful instant reanimation combo. Additionally, cards like Solitude and Quantum Riddler help control the board while Faithful Mending and Consign to Memory provide card advantage and utility. With a mix of control elements and powerful reanimation abilities, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with unexpected threats and powerful interactions.

The deck focuses on quickly developing the board with cheap artifacts and utilizing cards like Urza's Saga to generate value. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures like Kappa Cannoneer and efficient removal like Engineered Explosives. By utilizing cards that can generate card advantage like Thoughtcast and Mishra's Bauble, the deck aims to maintain tempo and pressure the opponent while disrupting their game plan with cards like Tormod's Crypt and Shadowspear. Overall, the deck seeks to have a fast and powerful start to close out games before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck aims to control the game by using powerful Eldrazi creatures and disruptive spells to disrupt opponents' strategies. It also utilizes the UrzaTron lands to ramp up mana quickly and cast big threats ahead of schedule. Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, Eye of the Storms are key cards that provide additional control and win conditions. The deck's main goal is to overwhelm opponents with its large threats while controlling the game with disruptive spells and powerful planeswalkers.

The key concept of this deck is to assemble the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Power Plant, and Tower) as quickly as possible in order to generate a large amount of mana to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures and game-ending planeswalkers. The deck focuses on control elements such as removal spells like Dismember and board wipes like All Is Dust to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while also utilizing Karn, the Great Creator to access sideboard options and lock down the opponent's artifacts. The deck aims to control the game until it can overwhelm the opponent with its powerful threats and resource advantage.
